metadata.title: CVE-2020-8244 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer over-read vulnerability exists in bl <4.0.3, <3.0.1, <2.2.1, and<1.2.3 which could allow an attacker to supply user input (even typed) thatif it ends up in consume() argument and can become negative, the BufferListstate can be corrupted, tricking it into exposing uninitialized memory viaregular .slice() calls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-bl - 4.0.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: node-bl package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-1').
